title: 'If Kyiv doesn't want peace â€¦': Putin's big warning ahead of Zelenskyy-Trump meet
content: Russian President Putin issued a stark warning to Ukraine, stating Russia will achieve its military goals if peace isn't pursued.  He highlighted progress on a border buffer zone and claimed advances in Donbass and Zaporozhye.  Meanwhile, President Zelenskyy emphasized that occupied territories and the nuclear plant are "red lines" ahead of his US meeting, prioritizing security guarantees.

title: '80 drones in 36 hrs': Pak's big admission on Op Sindoor; confirms damage to Nur Khan base
content: Pakistan's Foreign Minister Ishaq Dar has confirmed India's precision strikes on the Nur Khan Air Base in May, acknowledging damage and injuries. This rare admission follows similar statements by Prime Minister Shehbaz Sharif, detailing the impact of Indian drone incursions and missile attacks after Operation Sindoor. Satellite imagery corroborates the damage to multiple air bases.

title: 'RSS is like al-Qaida': Congress MP says Sangh 'breeds hate'; BJP hits out
content: Congress MP Manickam Tagore drew controversy by comparing the RSS to al-Qaeda, stating the organisation "breeds hatred and propagates hatred." This remark followed senior Congress leader Digvijay Singh's praise for the RSS's organisational strength. An RSS member, Indresh Kumar, criticised Tagore's comment as a reflection of the Congress leadership's "intellectual and mental bankruptcy."

title: Hadi murder: Police rejects B'desh claims of suspects entering India; calls allegations 'misleading'
content: Meghalaya security agencies have refuted claims by Bangladesh Police that killers of student leader Sharif Osman Hadi entered India. Officials stated there is no evidence of any individual crossing the border from the Haluaghat sector into Meghalaya, with the BSF maintaining high alert and constant surveillance.

title: Fresh unease in Cong? Digvijaya Singhâ€™s RSS praise sparks flutter; 'Godse' barb follows
content: Senior Congress leader Digvijay Singh's praise for the RSS's organizational strength sparked internal debate within the party. While Singh admired the RSS's ability to elevate grassroots workers, several Congress leaders dismissed the comparison, emphasizing their party's Gandhian roots and opposing the RSS ideology.

title: â€˜AI agents are becoming a problemâ€™: OpenAI CEO flags risks; offers $555K role
content: OpenAI is hiring a high-paid Head of Preparedness amid growing fears of AI systems exploiting security flaws and harming mental well-being. CEO Sam Altman acknowledged models are finding critical vulnerabilities, while also highlighting AI's potential psychological impact. The role will tackle cybersecurity, biosecurity, and self-improving AI risks, a crucial step as AI's dual nature becomes apparent.

title: 'Third party intended to marry': Ex-Pak cricketer's wife drops bombshell on divorce
content: â€œI am writing this from a place of deep pain. My home has been broken, and my children have been left without their father. I am a mother of three, including a five month old infant who has yet to be held by his father. This is not a story I wished to share, but silence should never be mistaken for weakness," she wrote.

title: 'Horrific': US slams mob violence on Hindu worker in Bangladesh; demands action
content: The US State Department has strongly condemned the "horrific" mob killing of Hindu garment worker Dipu Chandra Das in Bangladesh, demanding an unequivocal stand against religious hatred.  This statement follows growing concerns over attacks on minority communities. US lawmakers have also voiced outrage, urging condemnation of such bigotry. The incident highlights the precarious situation for religious minorities amid political shifts.

title: Key revelations in Udaipur IT manager gang-rape case; CEO, executive head arrested
content: Udaipur police have arrested an IT company CEO, Jayesh Sisodia, and two others for allegedly gang-raping a female manager in a moving car after a birthday party. The survivor claims she was drugged and assaulted, with dashcam footage reportedly capturing the incident. The accused are in police custody.

title: Ex-Tesla's AI director Andrej Karpathy warns programmers of falling behind
content: Tesla's ex-AI chief, Andrej Karpathy, warns software engineers face a seismic shift as AI reshapes coding. He admits feeling behind, highlighting a new 'programmable layer' of AI tools. While some studies show mixed productivity gains, industry leaders like Google and Anthropic remain optimistic about AI's role in development.

title: In search of Bharatiya 'porichoy': Will Matuas rewrite 'poriborton' in Bengal polls?
content: Why the Matua-Namasudra community views politics the way it does becomes clearer when one looks beyond electoral arithmetic, beyond BJP versus Trinamool Congress (TMC), and even before the creation of Bangladesh. The Matua movement, by the early twentieth century, had become as much a social force as a religious one.

title: 'He told me 15 days before': How Rohit helped set up Jaiswal's Test debut
content: Yashasvi Jaiswal's India debut was profoundly shaped by captain Rohit Sharma's early assurance and clear communication. Sharma informed Jaiswal of his selection fifteen days prior, fostering confidence. This trust allowed Jaiswal to debut with a remarkable 171, showcasing maturity. He credits Sharma as an elder brother figure, inspiring him and instilling the importance of upholding Indian cricket's values.

title: Assam: Minor attempts suicide after videos of sexual assault leaked; threatened with acid attack
content: A 17-year-old Assam schoolgirl attempted suicide after a 19-year-old youth allegedly leaked explicit videos of her online. The youth had subjected her to sexual torture and threatened her with acid attacks, using the secretly filmed videos to blackmail her into compliance.

title: 'Thought I was next Steve Jobs': Google founder shares lesson from early days
content: Google co-founder Sergey Brin shared a key lesson learned from the Google Glass failure, advising entrepreneurs to fully develop their ideas before public stunts. He admitted to rushing commercialization and aiming for a "Steve Jobs moment" prematurely.

title: Former Pakistan cricketer announces divorce from wife Sannia
content: Pakistan cricketer Imad Wasim has confirmed his divorce from wife Sannia Ashfaq after six years of marriage, citing unresolved issues and mutual consent. Sannia also confirmed the separation, attributing it to a third-party involvement that ended their struggling union. The couple has three children.

title: Twist in court: 2nd husband testifies for 1st; woman loses 17-year old domestic violence case
content: A 17-year-old domestic violence case took an unexpected turn when a woman's current husband testified, confirming her second marriage. This revelation led a Borivli court to rule she was no longer entitled to maintenance from her ex-husband, effectively ending her claim for protection and monetary relief initiated in 2009.

title: The Boogeyman & Melissa George net worth 2025: WWE legacy and earnings
content: WWE icon The Boogeyman, Marty Wright, and actress Melissa George have a combined net worth of approximately $7 million as of 2025. George's acting career contributes the larger share, with both having diversified income streams from their respective entertainment fields. Their success reflects legacy, audience loyalty, and decades of creative labor.

title: NFL rules on Dak Prescottâ€™s role in Chargers sideline altercation
content: The NFL has decided not to punish Dallas Cowboys quarterback Dak Prescott for his involvement in an on-field altercation. Following a dangerous hit on a teammate, Prescott exchanged words with the opposing player but was ultimately deemed to have acted emotionally but restrained.

title: West Bengal: Humayun Kabir's son 'assualts' cop in Murshidabad; detained
content: Golam Nabi Azad, son of Janata Unnayan Party chief Humayun Kabir, was arrested in Murshidabad for allegedly assaulting a police officer at his family residence. The officer filed a complaint after Azad reportedly objected to his presence and then assaulted him. Kabir claims the arrest is politically motivated by the TMC.

title: Bengaluru: Man gets life term for murdering wife; strangled her when sleeping pills didnâ€™t work
content: A husband was sentenced to life imprisonment for murdering his wife after she discovered a tattoo of another woman on his arm. He drugged her with sleeping pills mixed in beer, and when she survived, he strangled her. Circumstantial evidence, including CCTV footage and witness testimonies, led to his conviction.

title: Battle of the Sexes: How Sabalenkaâ€“Kyrgios match strips politics from a historic feminist moment
content: Tennis legend Billie Jean King distinguishes the upcoming "Battle of the Sexes" exhibition between Aryna Sabalenka and Nick Kyrgios from her historic 1973 match. King emphasizes her original contest was pivotal for social change and women's rights, a stark contrast to the current event, which she deems apolitical and primarily for entertainment and profit, questioning its benefit to women's tennis.

title: 'Iâ€™m really lucky': Chloe Kim praises Myles Garrett ahead of Olympic return
content: Chloe Kim shared heartfelt praise for Myles Garrett, saying she is inspired by his work ethic, kindness, and steady support. As she prepares for another Olympic season, the two-time gold medalist explained that their connection is built on respect, not fame. Kim said Garrettâ€™s character and encouragement help her navigate pressure while staying grounded and focused.

title: 'Cong all united': Digvijaya after RSS remark; condemns BJP's 'attempts to sow discord'
content: Digvijaya Singh asserted Congress unity amidst a BJP controversy over his praise for the RSS's organizational strength. He accused the BJP of trying to divide the Nehru-Gandhi family, emphasizing the party's solidarity. Singh clarified his stance, stating his opposition to the RSS and PM Modi while supporting a strong organizational framework.

title: 'It was awful stuff': Former cricket legend tears into modern batting after Boxing Day Test
content: Geoffrey Boycott attributed England's Boxing Day Test victory to superior fundamentals rather than luck, criticizing modern batting development. He argued that white-ball dominance and flat pitches hinder batsmen's ability to handle moving balls on seaming surfaces, a problem exacerbated by reduced County cricket. Boycott also highlighted Australia's ordinary batting, calling their dismissals "shockers" and the overall display "awful stuff."

title: How B'luru techie became Andhraâ€™s â€˜lady donâ€™; arrested for supplying 'Sheelavathi strain'
content: Nathavaram police have arrested eight individuals, including a Bengaluru software engineer, for smuggling high-quality Sheelavathi strain cannabis from Narsipatnam to Tamil Nadu and Sri Lanka. The operation, led by 'lady don' Gade Renuka, involved procuring ganja from Odisha and distributing it, marking a potential first for smuggling to Sri Lanka via the Andhra-Odisha border.

title: 'Most guests were Hindus': UP woman on Bajrang Dal's b'day disruption over 'love jihad'
content: Right-wing activists disrupted a birthday party in Bareilly, falsely accusing two Muslim guests of "love jihad" despite most attendees being Hindu. Police booked the Muslim guests and a cafe staffer for breach of peace, though an inquiry found no wrongdoing by the students. The victim stated the "love jihad" claim was unfounded.

title: Quote of the day by Geoffrey Chaucer: 'Women naturally desire the same six things...'
content: Geoffrey Chaucer, often called the Father of English Literature, rose from a merchant's son to a respected figure through diverse careers. His works, like "The Canterbury Tales," used "everyday English" to explore societal hypocrisies and human desires, influencing literature for centuries. Chaucer's genius lay in observing and portraying life without judgment.

title: Hounded after wife's suicide, Bengaluru man drives 1000 km to kill self
content: In a heart-wrenching incident, Suraj Shivanna from Bengaluru succumbed to despair and ended his life in a Nagpur hotel, mere days after his wife's unfortunate passing. Grappling with accusations of dowry harassment and the impending strain from his in-laws, Suraj and his relatives were attempting to escape when the incident occurred.

title: Brigitte Bardot, French film icon, passes away at 91
content: Legendary French figure Brigitte Bardot, revered as a global sex symbol and fierce advocate for animal rights, has died at the age of 91. She burst onto the scene in 'And God Created Woman,' captivating audiences before shifting her focus entirely to animal welfare, which ultimately earned her Franceâ€™s highest accolades.

title: 'Congress not just a party, but voice of India's soul': Rahul on party's foundation day
content: On the Indian National Congress's 140th Foundation Day, Rahul Gandhi declared the party as "the voice of Indiaâ€™s soul," that is committed to the weak, the deprived and hardworking people. He extended greetings, paid tribute to the party's legacy of winning freedom and strengthening democratic values, and resolved to fight injustice.

title: Year ender 2025: How women became the X-factor of the year
content: In 2025, women emerged as the decisive force, shaping outcomes across various spheres. From Operation Sindoor's symbolic and active response to terror, to women voters determining Bihar's fate, their influence was undeniable. New women leaders reshaped global politics, athletes dominated sports, and Roshni Nadar redefined economic power, marking a year of profound change.

title: 'Karnataka not Rahul Gandhi's colony': BJP slams Cong's Venugopal over eviction row
content: Karnataka BJP leader R Ashoka has slammed Congress general secretary K C Venugopal for his remarks on the Bengaluru demolition drive, accusing him of interfering in state administration. Ashoka questioned Venugopal's authority and highlighted alleged hypocrisy regarding waste dumping from Kerala.

title: Indian wine exports double from last year; Alphonso, jamun & more flavours
content: India's wine exports are surging, with fruit-based wines gaining traction alongside traditional grape varieties. A recent shipment of jamun wine to the US marks a significant milestone, as domestic consumption remains muted. While grape wines lead exports, non-grape varieties like mango and apple wines are also finding international markets, though producers face challenges with competitiveness and sustained demand.

title: Watch: Men in high-speed cars perform deadly stunts; Delhi Police responds
content: A group of men was captured on video performing reckless stunts and high-speed racing on Delhi streets, swerving through traffic and standing out of car sunroofs. The footage, shared widely on social media, prompted a response from Delhi Police, who have been informed and are verifying the video to identify the individuals involved.

title: 'Dhurandhar'Day 24 vs 'Tu Meri Main Tera Main Teri Tu Mera' box office collection day 4
content: Ranveer Singh's 'Dhurandhar' continues its box office dominance, reaching Rs 677.31 crore by its 24th day. The film surpassed the Sunday collection of 'Tu Meri Main Tera Main Teri Tu Mera,' which earned Rs 1.88 crore on its fourth day, bringing its total to Rs 20.38 crore.

title: Pakistan kabaddi player wears Indian jersey, waves tricolour; banned indefinitely
content: Pakistan international kabaddi player Ubaidullah Rajput has been indefinitely banned by the Pakistan Kabaddi Federation for playing for an Indian team in a private tournament in Bahrain without a no-objection certificate. Rajput claimed it was a misunderstanding, but the federation cited his participation and representation of an Indian team as violations.

title: Is NEET PG student data out for sale? Here is what we know so far
content: Recent media reports suggest NEET PG 2025 candidatesâ€™ personal dataâ€”including names, contact details, scores, and ranksâ€”may be circulating online and sold to private agents. NBEMS denies any breach at its end and has submitted a report to the Health Ministry. Aspirants face unsolicited calls, stress, and privacy concerns, highlighting the urgent need for transparency and stronger safeguards in the counselling process.

title: Ashes: Root joins Sachin, Ponting, Lara in elite list; becomes 9th batter to achieve this feat
content: Root, who had never scored a century on Australian soil, finally broke the curse as he scored an unbeaten 138 in the first innings of the second Ashes 2025-26 Test at Brisbane.

title: New Year's in Bengaluru: Parties must end by 1am; check rules
content: Bengaluru police have mandated that New Year's Eve celebrations at commercial establishments must conclude by 1 am. Venues are prohibited from exceeding their holding capacity and must close entry once full, with no waiting allowed outside. Offensive songs and slogans are banned, and security measures including screening and fire safety are compulsory.

title: Vijay Hazare Trophy: Virat Kohli's next match for Delhi - All you need to know
content: Virat Kohli made a sensational return to domestic cricket in the Vijay Hazare Trophy 2025â€“26, scoring 208 runs in his first two matches for Delhi. He became the fastest to 16,000 List A runs with a century against Andhra and followed it with a half-century and two catches against Gujarat.

title: Dehradun racial abuse: Tripura student stabbed to death; was called â€˜chinkiâ€™, â€˜momoâ€™
content: A 24-year-old MBA student from Tripura, Anjel Chakma, tragically died in Dehradun after a brutal stabbing, reportedly triggered by racial abuse. He was attacked on December 9th. The incident has sparked outrage and calls for justice, with authorities intensifying efforts to apprehend the main absconding accused.

title: Watch: 3 men harass woman rider for several kilometres in Bengaluru
content: Though an official X post, the SG Palya police station stated on Saturday that it had registered an FIR, arrested and remanded three men to judicial custody, who, according to a witness, were harassing a girl for several kilometres on a main road. According to the on-site witness, who recorded a video as evidence, the incident occurred before 10 pm.

title: What you need to know for every NFL game in Week 17 -- including fantasy tips, playoff implications, predictions
content: Seahawks vs. Panthers? Jalen Hurts vs. Josh Allen? Picks, predictions, stats and what's at stake for every remaining Week 17 game.

title: Henry up to 10th all time in rushing, Ravens win
content: Baltimore running back Derrick Henry moved into 10th place all time in NFL rushing yards Saturday night, finishing with 216, to go along with four touchdowns on the ground, as the Ravens produced a 41-24 win over the Green Bay Packers at Lambeau Field.

title: Bears clinch North title with GB loss; 1st since '18
content: The Chicago Bears locked up the NFC North on Saturday night at the conclusion of Green Bay's 41-24 loss to Baltimore.

title: Packers unsure on Week 18 QB after Willis shines
content: Packers coach Matt LaFleur was noncommittal about the team's starting quarterback for next weekend's regular-season finale after backup quarterback Malik Willis went 18-of-21 for 288 yards and a touchdown in Saturday's loss to the Ravens.

title: Slumping Lakers hold meeting, eye 'recalibration'
content: Lakers coach JJ Redick said Saturday was a day of "recalibration and reconnection" for slumping Los Angeles, which has lost three straight and six of 10.

title: Pels' Alvarado, Suns' Williams tossed after fight
content: Suns center Mark Williams and Pelicans point guard Jose Alvarado were ejected after getting into a fight in the third quarter Saturday night.

title: Team USA's Hutson struck by puck, out of hospital
content: Cole Hutson was briefly hospitalized after a puck appeared to strike him near the back of his helmet during Saturday's World Juniors game against Switzerland.

title: UVA sheds ACC title game loss, secures 11th win
content: Virginia quarterback Chandler Morris threw for 198 yards and the No. 20 Cavaliers, who lost in the ACC title game to Duke with a shot at the College Football Playoff on the line, outlasted 25th-ranked Missouri 13-7 in the Gator Bowl on Saturday night.

title: Giannis returns, draws Bulls' ire with late dunk
content: Giannis Antetokounmpo scored 29 points in his return from an eight-game absence Saturday night, punctuating the Milwaukee Bucks' 112-103 victory over the Chicago Bulls at United Center with a windmill dunk at the buzzer that drew the ire of the home team.

title: ðŸ‘€ How to do two coaching jobs during the CFP
content: Multiple CFP teams have coordinators taking head jobs elsewhere. For them, it's about compartmentalizing the chaos.

content: Will it be Donnarumma or Raya for best goalkeeper? Which two Sunderland players are in? Here are the season's top players as we near the halfway point.

content: Arsenal relied on an own goal for the fourth-straight game and their win vs. Brighton saw them do just enough.

content: Doug Greenberg goes inside the betting lines about the NFL MVP award, and Pamela Maldonado offers her best bet.

content: We are following the 2025 NFL season's playoff picture. Here's how things look right now for wild-card spots, division races and even the draft order.

title: A new United States champ; Three Stages of Hell for Rhodes vs. McIntyre
content: Friday's "SmackDown" saw a new champion being crowned and the Cody Rhodes-Drew McIntyre rivalry reaching a new level.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Chelsea eye Forest's England U21 star McAtee
content: Chelsea boss Enzo Maresca wants to be reunited with former Manchester City midfielder James McAtee. Transfer Talk has the latest news and rumors.

title: Vellore Corporation to complete pipeline work on Chennai - Bengaluru Highway
content: Corporation officials said that as the service lane and Green Circle witnesses huge traffic flow, the civic body is allowed to undertake pipeline work between 11 p.m and 3 a.m

title: Dhaka rejects Indiaâ€™s remarks over hostilities against minorities in Bangladesh
content: Ministry of External Affairs on Friday (December 26) said the "unremitting hostilities" against minorities in Bangladesh are a matter of "grave concern"

title: Survey reveals the dark side of loan recovery in India
content: Despite RBI guidelines and court rulings, borrowers say banks and recovery agents routinely resort to threats, intimidation and public shaming

title: Gautam Adani calls Sharad Pawar mentor
content: Signs MoU with Vidya Pratishthan, the Baramati-based educational trust associated with the Pawar family, to support research and development, placements and related initiatives at the AI centre

title: NITK uses machine learning to predict landslides in Western Ghats
content: The system combines rainfall analysis, real-time monitoring of soilÂ behaviourÂ and surface movement, and machine learning to provide reliable landslide warnings

title: Sabarmati flood victims get land rights after five decades
content: Ownership papers handed over to families displaced in 1973 as Gujarat launches major urban infrastructure projects

title: WINGS Thiruvananthapuram bird count records 188 species
content: 85 species, the highest among the 10 regions surveyed, was spotted at Kottoor forests. Arippa forest also  emerged as a species-rich site, yielding 83 species

title: Kerala politics spills over to Karnataka after eviction drive in Bengaluru
content: The statements of Kerala CM and AICC general secretary after an eviction drive in Bengaluru are seen as part of a narrative building exercise ahead of Assembly elections in Kerala expected early next year

title: Scouts and Guides helping shape childrenâ€™s personality, says Speaker
content: State-level Scouts and Guides Jamborette launched at Phoenix Public School in Honaga village of Belagavi district

title: At Indian History Congress, Kerala CM Pinarayi Vijayan  calls for resisting political distortion of history
content: Pinarayi Vijayan urges historians to defend evidence-based scholarship amidst growing attempts to rewrite history for ideological purposes, highlighting the systematic removal of key historical themes and figures from educational syllabi.

title: Congress seeks disqualification of Agali panchayat president
content: Congress member N.K. Manju had switched sides and became president of the Agali grama panchayat with the support of the LDF

title: CPI(M) to hold protest assemblies against new MGNREGS regulations
content: The scheme, which was originally fully funded by Centre, has undergone a significant shift to a 60:40 cost-sharing ratio between the Centre and the State

title: â€˜Ram Rajyaâ€™ is the benchmark for good governance, says Chandrababu Naidu
content: Lord Ramaâ€™s values and ideals are timeless lessons, and may they continue to guide and inspire us always, says the Chief Minister after offering special prayers at the Ram Mandir in Ayodhya

title: Winter Rains And Freezing Temperatures Compound Misery In Gaza
content: It only took a matter of minutes after the heavy overnight rain first began to fall for Jamil al-Sharafi's tent in southern Gaza to flood, drenching his food and leaving his blankets sopping wet.

title: "Blunt Aggression": Somali President Slams Israel For Recognising Somaliland
content: Israel's recognition of the breakaway region of Somaliland "is (a) threat to the security and stability of the world and the region," Somali President Hassan Sheikh Mohamud told an emergency parliamentary session Sunday.

title: "Have Faith In Top Court": Unnao Rape Survivor Over Bail To Kuldeep Sengar
content: The 2017 Unnao rape case has resurfaced in national headlines following the Delhi High Court's decision to suspend the life sentence of convicted former BJP MLA Kuldeep Singh Sengar.

title: Indian Accuses UK KFC Manager Of Race Bias, Wins Rs 81 Lakh Compensation
content: An Indian man who accused his manager at a KFC franchise outlet in south-east London of wrongful dismissal and race discrimination has won nearly 67,000 pounds in compensation after a tribunal ruled in his favour.

title: Pak President Admits He Was Advised To Move To Bunkers During Op Sindoor
content: Pakistan President Asif Ali Zardari has admitted that his military secretary had advised him to move to a bunker during the four-day conflict with India in May. However, he had declined that advice, he told a public gathering on Saturday.

title: As Congress Turns 140, New Challenges In New Year
content: India's Grand Old Party turned 140 this year - and is bracing for a new year that brings with it a lot of challenges. The 2024 Lok Sabha elections provided the Congress with fresh strength, but its series of defeats continued in all states except Jha

title: 4,000 Aspirants, 102 Posts: Long Queues For Odisha Home Guard Jobs
content: The deepening employment crisis in Odisha was laid bare on Sunday as more than 4,000 candidates sat for a written exam for just 102 Home Guard positions in Jharsuguda district.

title: National Conference MLA's Fund To Beautify J&K Temple Gets Local Support
content: National Conference MLA Sajjad Shaheen has taken a significant step to foster unity in Jammu and Kashmir's Banihal.

title: Tarique Rahman In Bangladesh: How His Father Was Assassinated 40 Years Ago
content: Surrounded by security, Tarique Rahman placed wreaths, offered prayers, and remained silent for several moments at his father Ziaur Rahman's grave.

title: Schoolgirl Uniforms, Sex Toys: What Jeffrey Epstein Bought Online
content: A set of 1,006 Amazon email receipts belonging to convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein, spanning five years, has been made public by the US Department of Justice.

content: Assistant Superintendent of Police (ASP) Shehrbano Naqvi of Lahore was seen taking a phone call mid-interview and returning an hour later, having handled the case.

title: "Oppose Their Ideology": Digvijaya Singh Clarifies Amid "RSS-BJP" Post Row
content: Congress MP Digvijaya Singh reiterated that he opposes the RSS and BJP's ideology, a day after an image he shared lauding Prime Minister Narendra Modi's rise through organisational ranks sparked rumours of a crisis within the Congress.

title: "Invader": US Influencer Mocks Indian-Origin Man Who Died In Canada Hospital
content: A US influencer is under fire for mocking the death of an Indian-origin man who waited over eight hours for treatment at a hospital in Canada.

title: Propaganda Debunked, Bangladesh Still Tries To Pin Murder On India
content: The police in Bangladesh have again alleged the two key suspects in the murder of radical leader Sharif Osman Hadi fled to Meghalaya in the northeast.

title: 80 Years Later, US Made 470-Kg WWII Bomb Removed In Serbia's Capital
content: A 470-kilogram (1,000-pound) World War II aerial bomb was safely removed on Sunday from a construction site in a central district of Serbia's capital, Belgrade, police said.

title: Elon Musk Reacts To Indian-Origin Man's Death After 8-Hour Wait In Hospital
content: Space and tech billionaire Elon Musk on Friday slammed the Canadian healthcare system following the death of a 44-year-old Indian-origin man, who died while waiting for over eight hours for medical attention.

title: Married Man Sexually Exploits Live-In Partner, Siphons 20 Lakhs In Bengaluru
content: Police in Bengaluru's Bagalgunte arrested a 29-year-old man on charges of alleged cheating, sexual exploitation and theft after duping a woman under the guise of a romantic relationship.

title: Humayun Kabir's Son Detained For Slapping On-Duty Cop In Father's Security
content: JUP (Janata Unnayan Party) chairperson Humayun Kabir's son, Gulam Nabi Azad, has been detained for assaulting an on-duty policeman.

title: Bangladesh's Ex-PM Khaleda Zia In "Extremely Critical" Condition, Says Doctor
content: Bangladesh's former prime minister Khaleda Zia is in an "extremely critical" condition, her personal physician has said.Zia  has been undergoing treatment at Dhaka's Evercare Hospital since November 23.

content: The Union Finance Minister inaugurates â‚¹18-lakh worth facilities at the Zilla Parishad High School at Pedamainavanilanka village in West Godavari, besides opening an AI skills hub provided by Cyient Limited in the village

title: Sharif Osman Hadi murder case: Two suspects fled to India, claim Bangladesh police
content: Two primary suspects in the murder of Inquilab Moncho leader Sharif Osman Hadi have fled Bangladesh. They are believed to be currently in India, a senior Dhaka Metropolitan Police officer said on December 28. The suspects have been identified as Faisal Karim Masud and Alamgir Sheikh.

title: NFL playoff-clinching scenarios: What's at stake for nine teams in Week 17?
content: eight more teams punched their ticket into the postseason during week 16 of 2025 . 10 of 14 teams have qualified for the playoffs with two weeks to go . five AFC teams and four NFC teams have a chance to secure something this week .

title: Where did the Staubach-Pearson 'Hail Mary' football end up after 50 years?
content: the cowboys beat the Vikings in their 1975 playoff game . a quarterback catches the "Hail Mary" pass from Roger Staubach . "your heart wants to believe everything you see is real, so you've got to be careful," says Adams .

title: Why Laveranues Coles decided to give up his cushy retired life to become an officer
content: laveranues Coles was approached by an elderly woman, a shopper walking to her car . she had no idea he was one of the NFL's most productive wide receivers from 2000 to 2009 . "i feel safe with you here," she told Coles .

title: Snap reactions to Week 17 games: Ravens' Derrick Henry scores 4 TDs in win over Packers
content: the Texans beat the Chargers to clinch a third consecutive playoff berth for the first time in franchise history . the game began on christmas day with an NFC East showdown between the Cowboys and the Commanders . Dallas jumped all over Washington early but had to hold on after giving up several big plays .
